    • sortBy1stArg

      public static void sortBy1stArg(gnu.trove.list.TIntList a, gnu.trove.list.TDoubleList b, gnu.trove.list.TIntList c, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive. Uses the optimized qsort3 from the book "Programming in Pearls" by Jon Bentley.
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to be sorted by same order as a
      c - items to be sorted by same order as a
      idxLo - low index of a
      idxHi - high index of a

    • descendingSort

      public static <T> void descendingSort(int[] a, T[] b, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive and by descending values. The swap operations performed on a are performed on b. Uses the optimized qsort3 from the book "Programming in Pearls" by Jon Bentley.
      Type Parameters:
      T -
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to be sorted by same order as a
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • descendingSort

      public static void descendingSort(int[] a, int[] b, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive and by descending values. The swap operations performed on a are performed on b. Uses the optimized qsort3 from the book "Programming in Pearls" by Jon Bentley.
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to sort
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • descendingSort

      public static <T> void descendingSort(gnu.trove.list.TIntList a, List<T> b, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive and by descending values. The swap operations performed on a are performed on b. Uses the optimized qsort3 from the book "Programming in Pearls" by Jon Bentley.
      Type Parameters:
      T - type of items in list b
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to be sorted by same order as a
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • descendingSort

      public static <S extends Number, T> void descendingSort(List<S> a, List<T> b, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive and by descending values. The swap operations performed on a are performed on b. Uses the optimized qsort3 from the book "Programming in Pearls" by Jon Bentley.
      Type Parameters:
      S -
      T - type of items in list b
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to sort by order of a
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • sort

      public static void sort(float[] a, int[] b, int[] c, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive. It's an adaption of the optimized qsort3 from the book "Programming in Pearls" by Jon Bentley.
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - an array that will receive the same swap operations as are performed on a
      c - an array that will receive the same swap operations as are performed on a
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • sortByDimension1FirstSecond

      public static void sortByDimension1FirstSecond(int[][] a)
      sorts along [0][index] and if there is a tie the value [1][index] is used to decide order.
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort

    • sortByDimension1FirstSecond

      public static void sortByDimension1FirstSecond(int[][] a, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sorts along [0][index] and if there is a tie the value [1][index] is used to decide order.
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      idxLo - the first index in [0][index] to sort
      idxHi - the last index in [0][index] to sort, inclusive

      public static void sortBy1stThen2ndThen3rd(float[] a, float[] b, float[] c, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive, with next sorting by b and c and all swap operations performed on all 3 arrays.

      b - items to be sorted

      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • sortBy1stThen2nd

      public static void sortBy1stThen2nd(double[] a, double[] b, int[] c, int[] d, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sort a from index idxLo to idxHi, inclusive, with ties sorted by b and all swap operations performed on all arrays. The sorts are ascending.
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to be sorted
      c - items to be sorted
      d - items to be sorted
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive

    • sort

      public static void sort(float[] a, float[] b, float[] c, int idxLo, int idxHi)
      sorts a, b, and c by the values of a only
      Parameters:
      a - items to sort
      b - items to be sorted
      c - items to be sorted
      idxLo - low index of a sort range, inclusive
      idxHi - high index of a sort range, inclusive
